messageBody:
Kent,

We added a TestResult field to TestCase, overrode fail() and made
methods in Assert non-static.

--- from TestCase ---
private TestResult fResult;
public void fail(String message) {
fResult.addFailure(this,new AssertionFailedError(message));
}

---- Test---------------
package junit.framework.test;

import junit.framework.*;

public class MultiFailureTest extends TestCase {

public MultiFailureTest(String name) {
super(name);
}
public void testMultipleFailures() {
TestCase test = new TestCase("multi failure") {
protected void runTest() {
fail("one");
fail("two");
}
};
TestResult result = new TestResult();
test.run(result);
assertEquals("number of failures",2,result.failureCount());
}
}

Regards,

David
